42881.name: Households using solid fuels as the main cooking fuel
42881.datasetName: Solid fuel use for cooking by region - Bonjour et al. (2013)
42881.s_name: Solid fuel use for cooking by region - Bonjour et al. (2013)

source.name: Solid fuel use for cooking by region - Bonjour et al. (2013)
source.dataPublishedBy: Bonjour et al. (2013) – Solid Fuel Use for Household Cooking: Country and Regional Estimates for 1980–2010. Environmental Health Perspectives.
source.additionalInfo:
95% Confidence Intervals for the years 1990, 2000, and 2010 are given in the Supplemental Material, Table S3. To give one example: The world’s households primarily relying on solid fuels for cooking declined from 62% to 41% between 1980 and 2010. The 95% confidence interval for 1980 is from 58% to 66% and for 2010 from 37% to 44%.

Countries are grouped by WHO region and income category (WHO 2012e; see Supplemental Material, Table S2).
